blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options specifying output file names for binary head and budget data.

variables.name: BUDGET FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary cell-by-cell budget output file.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for writing binary budget data. Common extensions are .cbc, .bud, or .cbb. This file contains flow terms for each cell and is used for post-processing water budgets.

variables.name: HEAD FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the binary head output file.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the file name for writing binary head data. Common extension is .hds. This file contains computed head values for each cell and is used for visualizing head distributions.

variables.name: BUDGETCSV FILEOUT
variables.description: Name of the CSV file for writing volumetric budget summaries.
variables.tooltip: Specifies a comma-separated values file for writing the overall model water budget summary. Useful for quickly reviewing inflows, outflows, and percent discrepancy.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period output control instructions specifying when to save or print head and budget data.

variables.name: SAVE HEAD
variables.description: Keyword to save head values to the binary head file for all time steps in this stress period.
variables.tooltip: Writes computed head values to the binary head file. Can be modified with ALL, FIRST, LAST, or FREQUENCY keywords. LAST saves only the final time step of the stress period.

variables.name: SAVE BUDGET
variables.description: Keyword to save cell-by-cell budget terms to the binary budget file for all time steps in this stress period.
variables.tooltip: Writes cell-by-cell flow terms to the binary budget file. Can be modified with ALL, FIRST, LAST, or FREQUENCY keywords. Required for post-processing water budgets and flow visualization.

variables.name: PRINT HEAD
variables.description: Keyword to print head values to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: Writes formatted head values to the listing file for review. Can be modified with ALL, FIRST, LAST, or FREQUENCY keywords. Useful for debugging but can produce large listing files.

variables.name: PRINT BUDGET
variables.description: Keyword to print the volumetric budget summary to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: Writes the overall water budget summary (inflows, outflows, percent discrepancy) to the listing file. Helpful for verifying model mass balance.
